info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® BUG OFF™ with Artilin Anti-Insect Technology is a water-based, low-VOC, anti- insect paint that is scientifically proven to kill disease-causing insects like mosquitoes for at least 3 years after application. FDA REG # HSR-8103

info.title: FEATURES
info.body: BOYSEN®® BUG OFF™ has inert microscopic crystals set in the paint layer that attack the nervous system of insects that get in contact with the painted surface.

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: Cleaning and Maintenance Carefully adhere to Surface Preparation and Painting Schedule instructions. Do not clean the painted surfaces within 7 days of application. To maximize the efficacy of BOYSEN®® BUG OFF™, lightly clean painted surface with a damp, non-abrasive cloth to remove dust. Do not use soap or detergents.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is recommended for walls and ceilings inside the house where it can quietly kill insects that use these surfaces for resting. It can also be used on exterior surfaces where harmful insects may gather. It is ideal for concrete, drywall, and *properly primed wooden surfaces . *Avoid using product on high friction areas such as fixtures and furniture.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: New Concrete
info.body: Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting. Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar. If neutralizing, treat surface with a solution of 1 part BOYSEN®® Masonry Neutralizer B‑44 diluted in 16 parts water, applying liberally by brush or roller. Let dry overnight before rinsing with water to remove white crystals that form on the surface. Let dry before painting. However, if the concrete has been cured for more than 28 days, there is no need for neutralizer.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
info.body: Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from dust, dirt, and other foreign matter. Hammer all nails deep enough to apply putty. Sand rough wood until smooth and then dust off before painting. Avoid using product on high friction areas.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Drywall Substrates
info.body: Install and secure joints as per manufacturer's recommendations.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Repainting
info.body: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using a paint and varnish remover, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. For repainting concrete with chalky old paint, use BOYSEN®® Chalk Blocker™ B‑7304 as a surface conditioner. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. For repainting other surfaces such as wood, follow the first step then apply the appropriate primer before recoating.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: For Concrete and Drywall Surfaces
info.body: Primer: BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ B‑701 or EcoPrimer B‑105 Putty: BOYSEN®® Masonry Putty B‑7311 (interior) BOYSEN®® Acrytex™ Cast B‑1711 (exterior) 2nd & 3rd coat: BOYSEN®® BUG OFF™

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
